conclusion: The side length of the square is L, charges at A and B are +q, charges at C and D are -q.
Distance from center to each vertex is L/2.
Electric field due to point charge q at distance r is E = kq/r^2.
Electric field due to charge at A at center is E_A = 4kq/L^2, direction towards A.
Electric field due to charge at B at center is E_B = 4kq/L^2, direction towards B.
Electric field due to charge at C at center is E_C = 4kq/L^2, direction away from C.
Electric field due to charge at D at center is E_D = 4kq/L^2, direction away from D.
Electric fields from A and B cancel each other, as do fields from C and D.
Total electric field at center is zero.
